snippet.textDisplay:
I believe someone told me that Fromsoft wouldn’t treat this as a live service game but imo it’s going to need more content than one large DLC many months after release to keep player retention. You NEED player retention with any game that uses online matchmaking, that is an undeniable fact and it can’t be argued against. Without player retention an online game is guaranteed to die. 

This is the only game I’ve played in recent years that would genuinely benefit from the traditional “seasonal” style updates. This game could last at least a few solid years if they release some quality updates once every 3-4 months, cycle out some of the night 1 and 2 bosses for other bosses from the franchise, add a new night lord and shifting earth, add 1-2 more dark souls reference skins for each character, etc. If they did that at least 4-5 times a year then they’ll see great player retention and it would justify making paid expansions 1-2 years from now because they’ll still have a healthy sized playerbase. Those paid expansions could easily budget parts of their future titles as well. 

Regardless of what people are saying now, they absolutely will get burnt out on this game in a few months once they complete remembrances, beat all the lords, and get the skins for the characters they like. It’s not like a traditional Souls game where you can make a new character and replay their entire story with a different build dozens of times. Yes this game has different characters, but you can complete everything those characters have to offer within a much faster time frame than replaying the entirety of a traditional souls game for your second or third time with a different build/playstyle. 

Nightreign’s foundation is absolutely flawless but if it doesn’t see any love in the form of small content updates every few months then people are going to quit because it’ll just be the same repetitive cycle with nothing to gain for your time invested. When this happens it’ll start getting much harder to get a team together through matchmaking and since duos don’t exist then you’ll be chalked if you and a friend want to do a run together.

snippet.textDisplay: Maybe make the Nightlords arena a bit more interesting than a plain sandfield. The only actual interesting aspect i have seen so far is during the Libra fight where you can make use of the slopes in the ground to stay out of reach of his rapid-fire projectile spell. Generally, making better use of the environment and somehow incorporating it into the gameplay would be the game far more interesting. I am not even gonna talk about relics, things are absolute ass. Increased attack power for 8s on thrusting weapons after your teammater farts while on low hp, they are just so niche and situational it's really pissing me off. Number modifiers for ridiculous situations. Adding something more fun wouldn't hurt, but that's a complain i have with from games in general and i doubt it's gonna change now. Or ever for that matter.

snippet.textDisplay:
Im happy they are enhancing the night lords, but what the game really needs is more enemy and boss variety. We need more bosses and enemies from er and ds to be added to the game as free content. The game needs to be treated as a genuine live service to continue living

I dont say this cause im poor or something, i already bought the deluxe edition. But the game will just objectively fall off if they dont make free updates alongside dlcs to flesh out the game. Its an amazing framework and has the potential to be the best fromsoft game ever made, but as it stands its just too barebones. 

The nightlords are actually one of the things that dont need to be more fleshed out, they are already some of the most interesting bossfights from have made. Its the day 1 and day 2 experiences that need to be fleshed out

snippet.textDisplay:
Jesus Christ. Have we as a gaming community really become slaves to the gaming enterprises? I can't believe how many people are just ok with a game being sold with full cut content locked into it's files, content that you paid for but can't play until they say so. There are mods for the Darkdrift Knight and Gaping Jaw fights on Nexus mods that release this cut content fully, why can't they just make new stuff? For crying out loud, at least 90% of the game is just full on copy paste from Elden Ring with number changes, they didn't even bother creating new weapons or something. Not to mention the thousands of bugs and connection issues.

Don't get me wrong it's a great game but it's absolutely CLEAR it's made out as a cash grab with little to no effort put in. People shouldn't be applauding this.

snippet.textDisplay:
Oh great. As someone who's not very good at this game, this is a whole lot of nothing. I'm still not getting the regular bosses down. And, with other games coming out I might just shelf this one. I said it from the start that I don't think it's smart for a multiplayer rogue-like to have the same design mentality as a single-player souls-like. A 40 minute run back is probably the most insane runback a souls-like has ever had. "Git Gud" kinda loses it's meaning when every death doesn't just lose you your runes, it loses you every level and every piece of equipment. 
Glad the hardcore players have fun, and I hope for your sake that there's more of you guys than of people like me. Why? Because a multiplayer game lives and dies on the player base. 
That said most professional streamers seems to focus on single player, and call the game "easy," so it seems like there's not a whole lot going for the multiplayer aspect? And if the professionals drop the game quickly too, then oof.
And I would like to point out that there's very little in terms of "rewards" for failing a run. Thus every run you fail on a boss you wasted about 40 minutes of no progress. Where as in Elden Ring I could either go do other bosses, and come back later when I'm stronger, or I could at least have a good go at learning the boss, because the runbacks are just a minute or two. Dark Souls had longer run backs, but they were predictable. (And as long as you picked up your runes you'd at least get more XP by the time you beat the boss.)
Relics are important to Nightreign, and yet all the good ones are locked behind defeating bosses, and the random drops are kinda not always exciting to get. Thus there's very little pull from the game after a while.
